content.description: Directions: Read the following selection carefully for comprehension. The selection is followed by a number of related questions and incomplete statements. Select the best answer or completion.
content.question: Catullus sends a message. Poetae tenero, meo sodali, velim Caecilio, papyre, dicas Veronam veniat, Novi relinquens Comi moenia Lariumque litus. (5) Nam quasdam volo cogitationes amici accipiat sui meique. Quare, si sapiet, viam vorabit, quamvis candida milies puella euntem revocet, manusque collo (10) ambas iniciens roget morari. Quae nunc, si mihi vera nuntiantur, ilium deperit impotente amore. Nam quo tempore legit incohatam Dindymi dominam, ex eo misellae (15) ignes interiorem edunt medullam. The words viam vorabit (line 7) are an example of

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 2.A: Describe features and functions of stylistic elements in Latin texts.
